page.title: 14APPLETON ROEBUCKS CLUBS 2
page.content: {Yorkshire Countrywomen's Association} The local branch was formed as a result of the break up of the Women's Institute (Yorks) in 1983.It meets each month on the 3rd Wednesday.Its programme is similar to that of a W.I. consisting of talks,visits, demonstra- tions and crafts. {Village Society}was formed to help to record local history and to help save threatened buildings,trees,hedges,foot paths and amenities.They have been working on a history of the village and are about to commence an oral history project. {Drama Society},produces an annual pantomime and a play at the Theatre Nun Appleton. There is an active{Playgroup}on three mornings a week. There is also a{PTA.} The same few people seem to serve on most committees.
